alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 01 at 2:34AM CST until March 01 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 6 PM CST this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Texas...Deaf Smith. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...1 to 2 with isolated 3. * Timing...1 PM to 6 PM Wednesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
